list_definition.definition: to see or know about before or in advance

list_ex_of_english: None of these activities had been foreseen in the early days of the project, or even to some extent at later stages.
Additionally, the government foresaw that forthcoming population aging would only make matters worse.
Intending death as a means and foreseeing it as a consequence have a number of features in common.
Furthermore, we do not foresee any significant problems in the extension of with references.
A decline in the ability to imagine and foresee undertaking activities in the future marked the loss of anticipation.
We foresee no problem with doing this, and plan to explore this approach in the future.
Likewise, legislators foresee the consequence of their voting decision in the whole legislative process.
This interpretation foresees the development of uniform approaches to agenda setting and policy-making.
